New Records: Tyrese Haliburton and Pascal Siakam each scored 25 points, with Haliburton adding 10 assists and Siakam also having 10 rebounds.
Key Match Events: Indiana took control with a 17-2 second quarter run that turned a 30-29 deficit into a 46-31 lead.
The Pacers started slowly from 3-point range, but Haliburton and Bennedict Mathurin turned the game with back-to-back 3s in the middle of that big spurt that put Indiana in control.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Steve Kerr said Green was bothered by a back injury and Curry had a bad knee.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Steve Kerr said it’s hard to take much out of a game with so many key players on the bench.
The Pacers' momentum continues to build, which looks like it’s finally found its rhythm.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Golden State was led by former Pacers star Buddy Hield who had 17 points.
Pat Spencer scored a season high 17 as the Warriors sat six players on their second game in two nights.
Others: Indiana has won all five games by 10 or more points, Haliburton has rediscovered his All-Star level, and with the Pacers getting healthy, their depth is helping, too.
